alert.note: Alert for Alger; Delta; Luce; Northern Schoolcraft; Southern Schoolcraft (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 4:48AM EST until December 22 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM EST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches from late tonight through Thursday. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible late Thursday night through Saturday night with heavy snow and low visibilities. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph...especially near the Lake Superior shoreline. * WHERE...Alger, Luce, Delta, Southern Schoolcraft and Northern Schoolcraft Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 7 PM this evening to 7 PM EST Thursday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Thursday night through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact multiple morning and evening commutes tonight through Sunday. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Alger; Delta; Luce; Northern Schoolcraft; Southern Schoolcraft
